Audience comments from the Caribbean Photographic Memories session, Leeds West Indian Centre, October 2013:

A St Kitts woman in the audience informed us that the sugar cane plantations in Barbados are now closed and the train has become a tourist attraction for a scenic route. Antonia Lovelace asked if there was any information on the train’s former use, and the St Kitts woman said: ‘not really’. Keeping the train going was the idea of the National Trust, or National Heritage of St Kitts, but they have not yet got as far as detailed information panels or a museum or trail of the sugar industry. Sugar cane used to be the biggest employer. You were only employed nine months of the year and had to survive through the remaining three months.
